description:
Job Responsibilities:

Manage product portfolio with respect to price and cost, working with various department such as operations and sales to ensure profitability of the business unit

Provide costing and pricing considerations for management team to make decisions on tenders and quotation

Conduct product cost review on a quarterly basis to analyse performance of different products across various market segments, including market share, price competitiveness, and value proposition against competitors

SPC for all SKUs within the company on a regular or on a continuous real time basis. (at least monthly) SPC for Channel, SPC for BUs. 

Perform analysis and simulations on varying pricing of different SKUs will have on the whole bottom line.  

Monitor the implementation of price change on a regular basis. 

Job Qualifications:
Qualification include a Diploma or above in Accounting/ Finance/ Mathematics/ Economics or related discipline

At least 1-2 year(s) of working experience

Preferably 1-2 years working experience in products and services pricing for tenders

Commercial/pricing experience in manpower intensive service industry

Ability to read through tender/sales contract and building a pricing table for our sales team

Possess good interpersonal, communication and presentation skill

Proficient in Microsoft Office applications

Able to work in a fast paced environment and meticulous

proficiency in Power BI is necessary

*Fresh graduates are welcome

description:
工作职责:
1、建立完善财务制度和内控体系、会计核算信息化体系；
2、对公司税收进行整体筹划与管理，审核税务申报的及时性和准确性；
3、负责组织编制公司的年度财务计划和预决算，并负责对预算的执行进行检查和分析； 4、审核公司资金计划，结合资金情况合理安排资金需求，对闲置资金合理提出理财建议；
5、负责对日常财务报表编制和日常收支报销各项工作的整体指导和审核、监督；
6、建立财务部管理信息资料库，并完善资料档案的收集、整理和调用等管理机制和系统化管理工作；
7、负责监督财务印鉴及票据管理，确保印鉴合规使用及票据安全；
8、根据公司财务状况定期或不定期地做好企业的财务分析，编写财务状况说明书，为企业制订经营政策提供依据；
9、集团及领导安排的其它事项。
10. 管理银行账户和银行关系，包括定期与银行互动以解决问题、银行账户管理和相关行政事务。
11. 执行贷款和债券利息支付以。 准备定期财务报告和报表。
12. 执行和维护企业融资项目，例如双边银行贷款，与法律团队一起审查贷款文件

任职资格:
1、本科及以上学历，财务、审计、金融、管理类专业；
2、10年财务工作经验，5年财务管理工作经验；
3、较强的对内、对外沟通能力，具有较好的团队组织和领导能力，有较强的责任心.

Duties/Responsibilities:


Lead annual budget process and work with business units to prepare annual budgets and forecasts.
Develop and maintain financial models for business units and prepare in-depth variance analysis and insight to support the performance review and business planning.
Monitor and analysis actual KPIs and financial performance against budget/forecast and identify the cause of variances.
Act as a business partner working closely with different stakeholders in operation teams and provide analytics support for performance improvement, cost saving and business development initiatives.
Provide data to support decision-making process through analysis, reporting, research, and effective use of data generation from internal and external information sources.
Conduct investment appraisals and feasibility analysis on potential acquisitions and new developments to support management planning and decision making.
Manage product portfolio with respect to price and cost, working with various department such as operations and sales to ensure profitability of the business unit
Provide costing and pricing considerations for management team to make decisions on tenders and quotation
Conduct product cost review on a quarterly basis to analyse performance of different products across various market segments, including market share, price competitiveness, and value proposition against competitors
Requirement:

Bachelors degree in Finance, Accounting or related field.

ACCA/HKICPA or equivalent professional qualification
Minimum of 10 years relevant finance and analytical experience.
Fluent in English and Chinese, including Mandarin.
Advanced Excel and financial modeling skills required. 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to details.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong business acumen.

selling_points: Opportunity to work for an international company
Located centrally in Hong Kong Island

description:
About us

The Alexander Pacific Group is a multi-national leader in the design and construction of architectural roof structures, pre-engineered building solutions and facades for the last 15 years. With a head office based in Australia and premises in Hong Kong, Philippines, and Las Vegas, this is a successful and dynamic business actively seeking to grow their market presence. This is an award-winning business who achieve international results. An opportunity to work in a growing global business doesn’t come along every day!

About the role

Due to business growth, the Alexander Pacific Group are looking for an experienced and detail orientated part-time Administration Officer to join their team based in Hong Kong Island. You will be supporting the Regional Director and the Hong Kong team with various administration duties and will initially work from home before transitioning into a new office later this year.

The key components of this role will be to:

Perform a range of office administrative tasks including answering calls, responding to enquiries, greeting clients and visitors, filing, and receiving and sending correspondence
Manage the Regional Directors calendar including booking meetings, sending invitations, and responding to requests
Collect cheques from various client and supplier offices and regularly deposit cheques at the bank
Collect mail several times a week
Update project information and data entry using various software including Salesforce 
Coordinate travel and accommodation arrangements for senior team members
Follow up with client and supplier invoicing and maintain a general ledger
Ensure office is running smoothly, and manage office consumables, equipment, purchasing and maintenance as required
Perform any other adhoc administration support including reporting, presentations and onboarding new team members

About you

To be successful in this role you will need to:

Have at least 2 years of relevant experience in an office administration role
Have experience in a global company within the construction industry (highly advantageous)    
Be proficient and fluent in both written and spoken English
Be familiar with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and Salesforce
Be a solutions orientated team player who is organised and detail-oriented
Have excellent time management skills and an ability to manage multiple competing priorities  
Have a positive attitude and be self-motivated
Be able to work part time, 25 hours per week Monday - Friday
Be able to commence after Chinese New Year

What’s In It For You?

This is a role with a huge amount of opportunity for the right candidate! You will have the chance to work alongside a highly skills team and develop your career with an established and growing company. There is a 13 month salary on offer and company medical fund benefits after probation.

How to Apply

Please send your applications by clicking the Apply button and submitting your resume with a 1 page covering letter detailing your suitability for the role.  Successful candidates will be contacted for an initial phone screen.
